Hello Kevin et al.,

I am a first year student at the Werkplaats Typografie  
If you have any questions I would be most happy to answer them.

[david@werkplaatstypografie.org](mailto:david@werkplaatstypografie.org)  
or / [info@werkplaatstypografie.org](mailto:info@werkplaatstypografie.org) and susanna should be able to help you.

Hey David,

Can you apply if you don't have a back ground in type design?

What kind of assignments do you get to do? I realise this is a broad question, maybe you can talk about what you're doing at the moment and tell us how it's going to be reviewed.

thanks

Hello Sebsan,

Yes you can apply if you don't have a background in type design. The participants have a broad range of backgrounds and interests. Not so specifically type design, but typographic design and a few with no formal design background at all. There seems to be a big emphasis on content and giving appropriate form to the content – whether it be self generated or given

At the moment my year are working on a 'reader' project which will eventuate in a book on the subject of biography

Also the WT is open to commision work, and every so often something comes in. For example a student here has just completed a series of stamps for the TPG Post. As for the review process, it is quite informal here, but we have an evaluation in december – so then I can tell you more!

Hope this helps,  
David
